alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 6:44AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Goshen and northeastern Laramie Counties through 730 AM MDT... At 643 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Meriden Rest Area, or 32 miles northeast of Cheyenne, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail, along with torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Very heavy rain could result in localized flooding of low lying areas. Locations impacted include... La Grange, Yoder, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Meriden Rest Area, Hawk Springs Campground and Hawk Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; Goshen County
